Danzig Tickets - Transition Despite the popularity of their albums with fans, Danzig has only had two hit singles, 'Mother' and 'Cantspeak'. This may be due in large part to a change in the lineup. In 1994, Chuck Biscuits left the band and was replaced with Joey Castillo. Then in 1995, John Christ and Erie Von resigned on the same day. The band finally stabilized in the late 1990s with Tommy Victor, Johnny Kelly, and Steve Zing. In spite of all the lineup changes, Danzig tickets increased in popularity with each album release Danzig 4 (1994). Danzig III: How the Gods Kill (1992), Danzig II: Lucifuge. Danzig continued to produce hit albums, including Danzig in 1988, and followed it in 1990 with Danzig Tickets - The Music The band released their first album, Danzig tickets began to sell.
